means: （为某目的或某段时间内的）花销，花费，开销

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"花费"之意。
means: cost ： 指花费时间、金钱、劳力等。其主语是物，而不能由人充当，也不用被动形式。
expend ： 较正式用词，通常指为某一专门目的而花费大量金钱、时间或精力。
spend ： 普通用词，与cost基本同义，但主语必须是人。
take ： 普通用词，指需要占用空间、时间或精力等，其主语可以是人，也可以是一件事情。

sentence.Network_en: I can't think of a worse way to spend my time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想不出更糟的消磨时间的办法。

sentence.Network_en: Novello says college students will spend $4.2 billion yearly on alcoholic beverages.
sentence.Network_cn: 诺韦洛说大学生每年在酒精饮品上会消费掉42亿美元。

sentence.Network_en: Businesses need to train their workers better, and spend more on R&D.
sentence.Network_cn: 各企业需要更好地培训工人，并且在研发方面加大投入。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English spendan, from Latin expendere 'pay out'; partly also a shortening of obsolete dispend, from Latin dispendere 'pay out'

encyclopedia.content: 1. 在使用spend时，主语只能是表示人的名词或代词。例如： Andy spent a lot of money on books. Andy花了很多钱买书。 2. 若表示"在。.....上花费锛埵奔洹⒔鹎蕊級",常用句型spend some money/ some time on sth.,介词on后接名词或代词。例如： Kitty spends two hours on her homework every day. Kitty每天花两个小时做家庭作业。 3. 若表示"花费锛埵奔洹⒔鹎蕊級做某事",则常用句型spend some money

entry.def: When you spend money, you pay money for things that you want.

example.ex: By the end of the holiday I had spent all my money...
example.tran: 到假期结束时，我已经花光了自己所有的钱。

example.ex: Businessmen spend enormous amounts advertising their products...
example.tran: 商人们花费巨额资金为自己的商品做广告。

entry.def: If you spend time or energy doing something, you use your time or effort doing it.

example.ex: Engineers spend much time and energy developing brilliant solutions...
example.tran: 工程师们花费很多时间和精力来开发完美的解决方案。

example.ex: This energy could be much better spent taking some positive action.
example.tran: 这些精力若用于采取某些积极行动的话，可能会更值得。

entry.def: If you spend a period of time in a place, you stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: We spent the night in a hotel.

entry.def: The spend on a particular thing is the amount of money that is spent on it, or will be spent.

sentences.sentence: "How are you spending your summer vacation?"
"I spend my pocket money in two days"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =expend,表示"花费,支付"; 2. 最初意思为"称重量而衡量……",引申出花费,支付; 3. =hang,表示"悬挂"

stems_affixes.word_buile: depend[v.[on]取决于,依靠,信赖,相信]+able可以……的→adj.可依赖的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 依靠的,依赖的,从属的;随…而定的
stems_affixes.word_buile: depend[v.[on]取决于,依靠,信赖,相信]+ent……的→adj.依靠的,依赖的,从属的;随…而定的
im进入+pending即将发生的→adj.即将发生的,逼近的
in不+dependent[adj.依靠的,依赖的,从属的;随…而定的]→不依靠[别的人,事或物]
pend悬挂+ing正……的→悬挂之中→即将发生的
per全部+pend悬挂+ic+ular表形容词→全部挂着的→垂直的
append[v.附加,添加,悬挂]+ix表名词→n.附录,附属物;阑尾,盲肠
pend悬挂+ulum东西→挂着[摆动]的东西→钟摆
per全部+pend悬挂+ic+ular表形容词→全部挂着的→垂直的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 花费, 消耗, 用尽
stems_affixes.word_buile: s+pend花费,支付→v.花费, 消耗, 用尽 v.度过, 消磨
ap加强动作+pend悬挂→挂上去→悬挂
de下+pend悬挂→附属于另一物件
sus在……下面+pend挂→挂在下面→悬挂

sentences.en: She would rather spend than save.
sentences.cn: 她有钱宁愿花掉, 也不肯积蓄。

sentences.en: He has spent all his money.
sentences.cn: 他把所有的钱都花光了。

sentences.en: He spent himself in the service of humanity.
sentences.cn: 他耗尽了毕生的精力为人类服务。

jushi.english: She would rather spend than save.
jushi.chinese: 她有钱宁愿花掉,不肯积蓄。

jushi.english: Don't spend without the thought of the next day.
jushi.chinese: 花钱不要只顾眼前而不想明天。
